benchmark_details.name: OmniBridge
benchmark_details.overview: OmniBridge is a unified multimodal framework that supports vision-language understanding, generation, and retrieval within a unified architecture. It addresses high computational costs and task interference through a two-stage training strategy and a latent space alignment mechanism.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To unify multimodal understanding, generation, and retrieval tasks in a single framework while minimizing computational costs.

data.source: Generated and adopted from various multimodal datasets including Flickr30K and MagicBrush.
data.annotation: Annotations were produced through a combination of crowd-sourcing and automated methods.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the standard evaluation benchmarks for multimodal tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in understanding, generation, and retrieval metrics indicate better performance.
methodology.baseline_results: State-of-the-art performance on benchmarks like M3CoT and RealWorldQA.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluations across established multimodal benchmarks.
